entry.title: You Voted, We Delivered: October 2025 SAP Commerce Cloud Influence Review
entry.content:
Your feedback continues to shape SAP Commerce Cloud! We’ve just completed our sixth Continuous Influence review since Q4 2022. Hundreds of requests and thousands of votes later, here’s what we delivered - and what’s next.

Why This Matters

Continuous Influence gives customers and partners a direct voice in shaping SAP Commerce Cloud. Your ideas and votes help us prioritize improvements that make your operations smoother, integrations easier, and business features stronger.

Results from October 2025

In this review cycle, we evaluated the top-voted requests and also some frequently mentioned through other channels like Customer Technology Advisory Boards (CTABs), user groups, co-innovation projects, and partner feedback.

Here’s the summary:

  • 9 Delivered
  • 1 Already Offered
  • 4 Planned (Long-term) – Next update in Q4/2025
  • 3 Under Consideration – Next update in Q4/2025
  • 0 Not Planned

entry.title: Unlocking the Next Chapter of Seamless Planning in SAP Business Data Cloud with Live Versions
entry.content:
Introduction

Seamless planning is generally available since Q1 2025. Since then, plan data resides directly in SAP Datasphere and with that, in the core of SAP Business Data Cloud. We are now thrilled to announce the release of live versions with QRC4 2025 (fast track wave 20.2025) that bring fact data into planning models without replication! Learn how this works, why it brings many planning use cases to a new level and how it benefits from the data product architecture of BDC. 

I also want to highlight more features that we are introducing in this context:

  • Detection of mismatches between fact and master data (postings on dimension members that are not part of your dimension tables)
  • Planning on live versions from other sources (e.g., Google BigQuery; not applicable for seamless planning and to be covered in a separate blogpost)

Watch out for more blogposts to come in the next weeks!

Use cases & benefits

You cannot plan in a data vacuum. Plans rely on reference data and input. That can be actual data, other plan data, external influencer data etc.  Until now, you were required to physically bring this data into your planning models using import jobs, uploads or data actions. Hence, live versions represent an advanced paradigm to data management and offer benefits in core planning scenarios for different personas. 

Accurate forecasts & plans: Live versions pull actuals, and external drivers directly from SAP Datasphere into your planning models - without replication. This removes latency and reconciliation work, so forecasts are built on the latest, governed facts from a single source of truth. Rolling forecasts and variance analysis become immediate and more reliable, reducing forecast bias and improving plan quality. Live versions can even feed SAP Analytics Cloud predictive scenarios with live data!

Extended Planning and Analysis: Cross-functional teams (finance, supply chain, sales, HR) consume the same governed facts directly from SAP Datasphere. Plans, assumptions and driver changes propagate instantly across domains, enabling end-to-end scenarios, consistent KPIs, and accelerating aligned decisions.

Operating a planning solution: No more nightly imports, manual uploads, or complex data actions to keep models current. Live versions reduce data movement & data footprint, simplify model building & operations, and lower TCO. Furthermore, the graphical modeling interface in SAP Datasphere lets you define joins, mappings, transformations etc. to bring data into the exact shape that you need for your planning model. 

SAP Business Data Cloud's data product architecture augments this opportunity.

  • Use SAP-managed data products and base planning models directly on curated data from SAP applications.
  • Use customer-managed data products from SAP BW PCE to support hybrid planning architectures while transitioning from BPC to planning in BDC. 
  • Integrate results from SAP Databricks via SAP Datasphere

How does it work?

Add data to an existing model

  • In your model details, you will find a new entry in the ‘Data’ section which is called ‘External Live Version Data Sources’
  • Here, ‘Connect External Data Source’
  • Choose an existing target version for the data source or create a blank version
  • Choose your fact view from your model’s SAP Datasphere space
  • Map the data source columns to your model’s columns
    • Not all source columns need to be mapped
    • Not all target columns need to be mapped
      • Measures can be NULL
      • Dimensions can receive a default member
    • Certain data type differences can be handled
  • If we detect a mismatch between the live version and your master data, we will notify you and you can add missing dimension members directly (not shown in the video)
  • You’re done! You can add more sources to the model, if you want

Adding a live version to a model

Build a model from an SAP Datasphere view

  • Create a new model
  • ‘Start with data’
  • Select SAP Datasphere as data storage location (=use seamless planning)
  • Select a space. The view you want to use as basis for the planning model must be in the same space or shared with the space
  • Select SAP Datasphere as datasource
  • Select your view
  • You now already see the live connection to the source view data
  • Create dimension tables as needed
  • Save the model
  • You’re done!

A usage example

In the following example, we add headcount (full-time equivalent / FTE) data to the previously created sales planning model because we want to add a calculation of revenue generated per sales employee.

  • We have an FTE planning model which is deployed to our SAP Datasphere space. Note that the fact table is exposed in the data builder.
  • We create a view on the fact table with a filter on sales employees in SAP Datasphere
  • We add the view to our sales planning model, do the mappings and add a calculation
  • In the story, we see the live data from the FTE planning model and the calculation result
  • When we change data in the FTE planning and publish it, the calculation in the sales model is refreshed in real-time

FAQ

Where can I use this feature?

This feature is available for SAP Analytics Cloud models that use SAP Datasphere as data storage location (=seamless planning models).

Can I use any fact table/view from SAP Datasphere?

You can use fact views that are exposed for consumption. They must be available in the space that your model is deployed to. They can be shared with the space as well.

Can I also add data from other planning models?

You can add data from other seamless planning models if they are deployed and exposed in the same space or if the exposed data has been shared from another space. You need to create a view on top of the tables which is exposed for consumption.

What can I do with live versions? (And what can I not do?)

You can display the live version data in the model data foundation and in tables, charts, etc. in stories.

You can reference the live version data in model and story calculations as well as data actions (incl. advanced formulas).

You cannot write back into the referenced views (or rather their underlying tables). You can copy the live version data into planning versions via copy/paste in the table, data actions and version management.

How do I see if data is live or not?

In models, a live version is highlighted in the data preview. In the version dimension, you see the data source per version.  

In tables, live version data is locked for data entry and formatted accordingly. Reasons for unplannable data give accurate information.

Is SAP Datasphere Data Access Control considered?

Yes, it is.

Do planners need to have certain roles in SAP Datasphere?

Only if a user has a consumer role for the underlying space, he will be able to see live version data. Otherwise, he can use the planning model but will not see live version data.

Data access control applies as well.

What about live access to master data?

Live access to master data is future enhancement with high priority.

Conclusion

Live versions bring seamless planning to the next level and unlock a lot of value for planning in SAP Business Data Cloud. I am delighted to announce the general availability in Q4 2025.

entry.title: Re: Streamline Data Migration from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA: Selective Data Transition with Time-Slice
entry.content:
Hello @matthiasstegmue 

I have another question. We are currently considering an SAP S/4HANA conversion for a customer running SAP ECC 6.0 on Oracle, with a database size of approximately 7 TB. The S/4HANA sizing estimate is around 2 TB for a traditional DMO full migration/conversion.

As per your previous response, the only reliable way to obtain a clear sizing estimate for an SAP Lean SDT conversion is to perform a proof of concept (PoC), which we are now evaluating. (As shown in the screenshot above, Lean SDT typically indicates a footprint reduction of over 50%.)

That said, some external parties have advised the customer that SAP Lean SDT is not recommended for source systems larger than 5 TB, and that a preliminary data archiving project on the source system is strongly advised. Their rationale is that Lean SDT would take significantly longer to migrate data from large ECC systems, potentially causing performance issues during the process.

I have reviewed the available SAP Lean SDT documentation but could not find any explicit restrictions or recommendations regarding system size. Could you kindly shed some light on this, or confirm whether such limitations exist? Are there perfromance issues related to source system size, even if a subset of the data is migrated ?

Kind regards,

entry.title: Re: CDS/API/BADI to populate CUP and CIG fields in Itly t...
entry.content:
Hello @Neha_Chauhan78 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, P.IVA, CUP, and CIG are not included in the Accounting Document Read API. Instead, use the API_BUSINESS_PARTNER to retrieve P.IVA, and obtain CUP and CIG from the Italy e-invoice (eDocument) XML for SD billing or from the Purchase Order on the MM side. If CUP and CIG are required on billing APIs, consider adding custom fields and populating them with appropriate logic.

Check KBA SAP Support Portal-3317650 - Italy eDocument XML CUP/CIG CUP/CIG in Italy eDocument XML are provided via custom logic and KBA  2691140 - CUP and CIG in purchasing CUP/CIG supported on PO header in Public Cloud; for broader eDocument troubleshooting, see KBA 2696897.

Let me know how it goes

With regards

Chuma

With kind regards

entry.title: Re: Adding existing field to FIORI application
entry.content:
Dear @vignesh_a ,

It seems you're looking to add a custom field from QMEL to the Fiori App. To achieve this, you first need to create a UI extension project using WebIDE. Next, identify the relevant view of the UI5 application. Once identified, create a View extension for that view and add the new field in the XML view. Additionally, the backend service requires an OData extension to support the new field. You may need to involve an ABAP developer to handle the service extension logic.

Hope this will give you a good start. 

BR,
Sudheer

entry.title: Re: In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, We can't use the...
entry.content:
Hello @Kimaro 

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud lacks the Cumulative option for Profit Centre allocations. It's only available for Cost Centre. To replicate this, you need to perform a monthly YTD true-up

Allocating Amounts Between Profit Centres in Universal Allocation explains that, in the Profit Centre context, you can only post to G/L types X (Balance Sheet) or N (Non-operating), not P and S. Check again SAP Support Portal -KBA 3114399 - Allocating Amounts Between Profit Centers in Universal Allocation

The SAP Help Universal Allocation Profit Center Context page describes allocation behaviour in the PC context. SAP Help Portal-Universal Allocation (Profit Center Context)

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Decentralized EWM QM Configuration
entry.content:
Intro
This blog explains the complete configuration flow for integrating SAP QM with decentralized EWM, covering key topics such as inspection lot creation, follow-up action mapping, posting change types, and warehouse task control. Whether you’re implementing EWM for the first time or fine-tuning an existing setup, this guide provides the functional and technical clarity needed for a smooth EWM–QM integration.
Overview

Main part: - Decentralized EWM configurations:
Define External QM Systems (EWM)
SIMG - SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Quality Management for Decentralized EWM -> Basics and Integration -> Communication with an External QM System -> Define External QM SystemsAttributesInstallations 

Event Type Linkage for QM Data in Procurement (EWM)
SIMG -> Quality Management -> Environment -> Tools -> Communication with Quality Inspection Engines -> Activation of Events for Transferring QM Data in Procurement -> Event Type Linkage for QM Data in Procurement
Generate Inspection Object Type Versions (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Basics and Integration -> Generate Inspection Object Type Versions

Maintain Inspection Object Types Version (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Basics and Integration -> Maintain Inspection Object Types Version

Define and Activate Warehouse-Dependent IOTs (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Basics and Integration ->
Define and Activate Warehouse-Dependent IOTs


Define Indexes for QIE Objects (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Quality Management for Decentralized EWM -> Basics and Integration -> Define Indexes for QIE Objects

Execute report QIE_INDEX_UPDATE in transaction SA38 and select the same entries which were maintained before
Define Number Ranges for Inspection Documents (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Quality Management for Decentralized EWM -> Inspection Planning -> Define Number Ranges for Inspection Documents

Define sample Item Types (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Quality Management for Decentralized EWM -> Inspection Planning -> Samples and Items -> Define Item Types

Define Decision Codes (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Quality Management for Decentralized EWM -> Inspection Results -> Define Decision Codes

Maintain Follow-Up Actions (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EWM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Quality Management for Decentralized EWM -> Inspection Results -> Maintain Follow-Up Actions

Note: Note: For follow-up actions S2CC (Scrap to Cost Center) and SMPC (Sample Consumption), you must assign a cost center when recording the usage decision. You assign the cost center selecting EWM Inspection in the Record Usage Decision app (transaction QA11). To assign or determine a cost center, you must choose EWM Inspection.

To be able to select a cost center in the decentralized EWM system, you need to maintain your cost center in the Administration of Account Assignment Data app (transaction /SCWM/ACC_IMP_ERP). Alternatively, on the SAP Easy Access screen, choose Logistics → SCM Extended Warehouse Management → Extended Warehouse Management → Interfaces → ERP Integration → Administration of Account Assignment Data.

Set Up Master Data Synchronization (EWM) (Optional Step)
New feature added in S/4HANA 1909 that reduces manual effort for maintaining inspection rules in decentralized EWM on S/4HANA. The inspection setup maintained in the material master is distributed to the decentralized EWM system and creates or updates in background required inspection rules.

Navigate to Enterprise Business Applications→Supply Chain→Warehousing→Extended Warehouse Management (EWM)→Quality Management→Quality Management for Decentralized EWM→Master Data Synchronization

You can use the preconfigured settings in the business configuration (BC) set EWM-QM Material MD Synch. for Inbound Processes (/SCWM/QM_MASTER_DATA_SYNC_IDOC). To activate BC Sets, on the launchpad choose Tools→Customizing→Business Configuration Sets→Activation of BC Sets (Transaction SCPR20).

Maintain a partner profile for the logical system (Partner Type LS) in the Partner Profiles app. On the launchpad, choose Logistics→ Logistics Execution→Internal Whse Processes→Communication with External Systems→ALE Administration→Runtime Settings→Partner Profiles (Transaction WE20).

Maintain the inbound parameters for message type MATQM and process code /SCWM/MATQM.


Define Insp. Rule Settings for Inbound Inspections (IOT 4) (EWM)
SIMG -> SCM EEM -> EWM -> Cross-Process Settings -> Quality Management -> Quality Management for Decentralized EWM -> Basics and Integration -> Communication with an External QM System -> Define Insp. Rule Settings for Inbound Inspections (IOT 4)


Settings in ERP System (ERP)
SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Quality Management -> Quality Inspection -> Inspection Lot Completion -> Edit Code Groups and Codes for Usage Decisions


Edit Selected Sets (ERP)
SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Quality Management -> Quality Inspection -> Inspection Lot Completion -> Edit Selected Sets for Usage DecisionsMaintain Inspection Type (ERP)
SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Quality Management -> Quality Inspection -> Inspection Lot Creation -> Maintain Inspection Types

Maintain Inspection Lot Origins and Assign Inspection Types (ERP)
SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Quality Management -> Quality Inspection -> Inspection Lot Creation -> Maintain Inspection Lot Origins and Assign Inspection Types

Define Default Values for Inspection Type (ERP)
SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Quality Management -> Quality Inspection -> Inspection Lot Creation -> Define Default Values for Inspection Type

Activate Business Transaction Event QBEXT (ERP)
SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Quality Management -> Environment -> Tools -> Communication with Quality Inspection Engines -> Activation of Events for Transferring QM Data in Procurement -> Activation of BTE Application

Additional Settings for Partial Quantity Decision (ERP)
Transaction BD54 - Create logical system
Transaction BD97
Create the connections to opposite systemTransaction SM59
Maintain the trusted RFC connections in opposite systems

Conclusion:
A well-designed EWM–QM setup not only minimizes manual intervention and posting errors but also improves traceability and compliance throughout the supply chain. By aligning ERP and EWM processes effectively, organizations can achieve both operational efficiency and consistent product quality, ensuring that every stock movement reflects accurate quality status in real time. ChatGPT 🙂

entry.title: Re: how to finish installation without license
entry.content:
Hello,

You need to check SAP note: 2606876 - How to request a license key for SAP Crystal Reports? - SAP for Me

Steps are as below and if you have enough license you can use same key. Pay attention to highlighted in RED below. 

 

To generate a license key for Crystal Reports:

  1. Go to SAP for Me > License Keys
  2. Select/Search for the installation number
  3. Click: + Add System
  4. Enter the system data as follows:
    • Product: SAP Crystal Reports
    • Version: SAP Crystal Reports **** (select the appropriate version from the drop-down, e.g. 2025, 2020, 2016, 2013)
    • System ID: Enter any 3 alphanumeric characters starting with a letter A-Z (e.g. "C16")
    • System name: Optional
    • System type: Select from drop-down (e.g. Development, Test, Productive..)
    • Operating System: Select from drop-down if not pre-populated (e.g. Microsoft Windows)   
  5. Click Continue
  6. Click + Add License Key
    • Material: Select from drop-down list (Note: the "Licensed" number is the total quantity licensed for that particular license material)
    • Version: Select the version you need (Note: the "Remaining number" is the amount you can create a license key for)
    • Number of Licenses: Enter an amount up to the "Remaining" quantity  
  7. Click Add
  8. Repeat Steps 6-7 if you want to generate additional license keys for the same product and version
  9. Select the license keys from the list
  10. Click Generate
  11. The license key will be generated immediately so you can copy and use it during the SAP Crystal Reports software installation.

Thank you

Yogesh

entry.title: Re: Is it Mandatory to have Cloud foundry runtime with Bu...
entry.content:
Yes, Cloud Foundry runtime is mandatory for SAP Business Application Studio. To use SAP Business Application Studio, you must have Cloud Foundry enabled in your subaccount 

Ref: Exploring SAP Business Application Studio - SAP Community

-Yogesh

entry.title: What’s New in SAP Ariba Category Management
entry.content:
• Category Risk Assessment

Standardize how you evaluate risks across all purchasing categories. With contextual scoring for causes, impacts, and mitigation steps, teams can now view overall risk at a glance across business units, regions, and timeframes.

  • Multiple Tool Documents in Strategy & Plan

Attach multiple analysis documents such as cost structures or market dynamics to a single strategy or plan. Each can be tailored for different categories, regions, or business units, creating a richer, more flexible strategy.

  • AI-assisted strategy summarizer

Speed up reviews and approvals with AI-generated summaries of strategy documents. These concise overviews highlight the most important points, helping stakeholders review and approve faster.

  • Strategy & Plan PDFs

Easily generate read-only PDF versions of strategy and plan documents for stakeholders who don’t have SAP Ariba access, ideal for leadership reviews or audits.

  • AI-Assisted Category Strategy Recommendations

Use supplier preferencing insights to guide strategy decisions. AI-based recommendations analyze historical data and assessments to improve supplier engagement and decision-making.

  • Operational Reporting API
Operational reporting API is now available with SAP Ariba Category Management. The intended business use is to allow customers to use data from SAP Ariba Category Management for analysis, reporting, and insight retrieval in any compatible external tool. Operational data points associated with the following can be retrieved for external tool consumption:
–Category lists
–Category attributes
–Category profiles
–Strategy and plan documents
  • Ability to view, analyze, and manage initiatives across categories

Monitor progress of initiatives across categories and regions in one view. Identify areas behind plan and make informed, proactive decisions faster.

entry.title: Re: Can I modify the behaviour of the fields in CJ20N?
entry.content:
Yes, it is possible to set the behavior of custom fields in CJ20N, including making them read-only based on certain logic. This can be achieved through several approaches:

Field Control Implementation Options

1. BADI Implementation You can implement Business Add-Ins (BADIs) to control field properties dynamically. BADIs allow you to define custom logic that determines when fields should be read-only, mandatory, or hidden based on specific conditions.

2. Screen Enhancement Since you're looking at screens 600 and 700 of program SAPLXCN1, you can implement screen enhancements to modify field properties. This involves:

  • Using LOOP AT SCREEN statements to modify field attributes
  • Setting the screen-input parameter to control read-only behavior
  • Implementing the logic within the appropriate screen processing events

3. Field Selection Methods For custom fields, you can utilize field selection methods that allow dynamic control over field properties. These methods can evaluate your business logic and set appropriate field statuses.

entry.title: Re: Export data from SAC to ECC
entry.content:
HI @Pranav_Vyas27 ,

Currently, there is no direct export option to SAP ECC system. Export options available are to S/4, IBP, BPC and OData services. You can use Odata services to load data to ECC or Export the data to a file to the shared drive and load to SAP.

-- Selva.

entry.title: Error with BAdI Implementation PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m currently implementing the BAdI PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. My goal is to include custom logic for calculating the condition type TPE1.

Here’s what I’ve done so far:

  • In the BAdI implementation, I inserted my logic for condition TPE1 and assigned the enhancement ID FORMULA=TPE1. (see screenshot placeholder)

  • After publishing the BAdI, I went to the configuration activity Set Alternative Calculation of Condition Amount (102430)
  • I created a new calculation routine with the number 3009999 and linked it to the enhancement identifier TPE1, which I had used in the BAdI. (see screenshot placeholder)
 

 

  • Then, I assigned this routine in the pricing procedure under the Condition Amount calculation field.

However, when I test the BAdI during pricing execution, I get the following unexpected error message:

“Enhancement identifier for routine number 3009999 must exist.”

I’ve already double-checked the enhancement ID and configuration, but I couldn’t find any additional details or documentation related to this specific error.

Has anyone faced a similar issue with this BAdI or the linkage between the enhancement ID and the routine number in the configuration? Any insights or troubleshooting steps would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your help!

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Mapping company codes for the SAP MDI in S4 Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @ildar_dlw ,

You see, Company code YYYY has not been created in financial accounting because the company code in the workforce message doesn’t exist in the S/4HANA Public system. There’s no mapping table for this flow. You have two options:

I you prefer to keep the IDs consistent.

Replicate company codes from S/4HANA Public Cloud to SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) and use those exact values in SuccessFactors Employee Central, ensuring the Legal Entity External Code matches. Then, resend the workforce message. SAP Help Portal/Company Code Replication: Setup Instructions

If EC needs to maintain different codes.

Perform translation in SAP Cloud Integration using Value Mapping in EC → S/4 HANA Public cloud iFlow to map EC code to S/4 company code. SAP Help Portal-SAP Integration Suite-Creating Value Mapping

Quick checks to close this out.

In Manage Workforce, open the worker’s Work Agreement and verify that the Company Code exists in S/4. SAP Help Portal-Manage Workforce

Use Message Monitoring to reprocess the failed message after fixing the code alignment. SAP Help Portal-Message Monitoring

Ensure the MDI workforce replication setup is completed and active. SAP Help Portal-Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition-Workforce Person Replication

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Comparison Between BW and Datasphere
entry.content:
Comparison Between BW and Datasphere

Deployment ModelOn-premise data warehousing solution with support until 2040 Cloud-native data management platform on SAP Business Technology Platform
ArchitectureMature, enterprise-scale platform refined over 20+ years Data Warehouse as a Service (DWaaS) with rapid release cycles
Data IntegrationPrimarily batch-oriented data extraction from SAP and non-SAP systems Supports both real-time and batch data integration from diverse sources including cloud applications, data lakes, and IoT sensors
Analytics CapabilitiesSpecializes in data warehousing and reporting with robust analytical capabilities Advanced analytics including predictive analytics, machine learning, and AI-powered features
Business ContentComprehensive business content and extractors tailored for SAP environments Seamlessly integrates with SAP Analytics Cloud and supports modern analytics paradigms
Modern FeaturesTraditional enterprise data warehouse functionalityMultilingual support, currency conversion, time-dependent attributes, hierarchies, navigation attributes, variables 
Migration OptionsSource system for migration to DatasphereTarget system with multiple migration paths: Shell Conversion, Remote Conversion, Hybrid Scenarios 
Strategic PositioningStable choice for existing implementations with long-term support SAP's strategic direction for new data warehousing projects
Advanced CapabilitiesProven stability and enterprise-scale operationsGenAI, Data Marketplace, knowledge graphs capabilities
Support TimelineSupported until 2040 Continuous innovation with fast release cycles
Conversion ToolsSource system requiring SAP BW Bridge Transfer Cockpit for migration Provides SAP BW Bridge for reusing existing BW investments
Prerequisites for MigrationSAP BW 7.30+ or SAP BW/4HANA 2021+ Requires provisioning of SAP Datasphere with BW Bridge capability
Hybrid ScenariosCan expose models to Datasphere while maintaining on-premise operations Supports consumption of BW models through hybrid integration

entry.title: Re: Accept Zero as a valid value in a currency field
entry.content:
If 0 is a valid value, then the field isn't technically a 'mandatory field'. So, first thing to do would be to make the field as non-mandatory.

If the intention of the requirement is to make sure user made an entry in the field, then you can set the initial value of the field to be -1 and add a validation to check if amount negative. Thus,

  • When the field is initially displayed, then amount will be defaulted to -1. 
  • If user doesn't make any changes, then validation will catch that and throw an error back to the user, because the amount is negative
  • If user makes changes and enters the amount as 0 or non-zero positive number, validation will be successful and let the user proceed.

entry.title: Re: LAUNCHPAD SCREEN ERROR - FIND MAINTENANCE ORDER
entry.content:
Good day @MrAdilsonBenevides 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at: Maintenance Notification & Display Maintenance Notifications for more details

To summarise, the no generic launchpad error you get appears because your user’s business role is missing the Fiori catalog that contains the Display Maintenance Notification app and the navigation intent for it.

You have a few options to manage that situation:

First is to make sure you assign role SAP_BR_MAINTENANCE_MANAGER or SAP_BR_MAINTENANCE_PLANNER to you user.

Thereafter, ensure your catalog SAP_EAM_BC_NOTIFICATION_DISPLAY_PC is available too. Then refresh your Fiori Launchpad and retry it. This should eliminate that error you received.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Fixed Asset Migration with Asset Sub number errors
entry.content:
Hello @AikoFC 

The FAA_MD 35 error, "Main asset does not exist in company code," occurs when sub-asset entries point to a main asset that the system has not yet created.

Please follow the proper procedure for S/4HANA Public Cloud.

If your asset class uses internal numbering (default): leave the Asset field blank for all rows, set Sub number to 0 for the main asset, and 1, 2, 3... for the sub-assets, using the same Old Asset value to group them. Load the main asset and sub-assets together in one package, with the main row listed first.

If you are adding subs to an existing main (external numbering): use the actual system main asset number in Asset, assign the correct Sub number (1, 2, ...) and verify that the Company Code and Asset Class match the main.

For detailed guidance, see the below KBA’s.
KBA 3596371 – “Error ‘Main asset does not exist in company code’ while migrating asset sub-numbers.”
KBA 2827574 - Migration Cockpit: Collective KBA for migration objects Fixed Asset

Let me know if it works

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Change Acct Assmt Grp Mat. field in Manage Credit Mem...
entry.content:
Good day @KhaingZinTun 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these Extensibility & Key User Extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Sales links for more details

In summary, the field you are you are trying to change is a field that comes with the Material Master and therefore drives account determination in SD to FI integration. That means you cannot change the field directly through Custom Logic because it is not released for modification in public cloud. The reason for that is, it ensures the system maintains reconciliation consistency. However, you have options to adjust account determination behaviour:

  • The first is the SSCUI for Account Assignment Groups and Revenue Account Determination. (Manage your Solution à Sales à Basic Functions à Account Assignment)
  • The second is, to create a rule in the manage substitution/Validation rules app to help you adjust assignments dynamically.

For your reference, you can check released BadIs such as SalesDocumentItemPrepare and SalesDocumentItemModify. They allow value influence for eligible fields.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Triggering Debit Memo via Quality Notification Action...
entry.content:
Good day @Suresh-Eswaran 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, it is possible to trigger a Debit Memo Request from a Quality Notification Action Box for supplier complaints. This requires ensuring QM and SD is active.

You can do this by adding a new action box entry under your supplier complaint notification type, thereafter, assign it to the released follow up function for Sales Document Creation. Once you do this, you will see the Create Debit Memo Request option in the action box within the Manage Quality Notifications app.

Have a look at the references below for further details.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Connect SAP Business Application Studio and...
entry.content:
Hello @AustinKloske 

Thank you for the details. The connection issue between SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) and SAP S/4HANA Cloud happens because the authentication setup is incomplete or inconsistent. Please follow the steps below to resolve it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials in your BAS destination.

In S/4HANA Cloud, create a Communication Arrangement for the API and copy the Token Service URL / Client ID / Client Secret.

In BTP → Destinations (same subaccount as your BAS development space): configure Authentication as Oauth2clientcredentials, including the three aforementioned values, and additionally set Webideusage to odata_gen and sap-client to 100.

Check Connection → then retry the BAS generator.

 KBA 33263919 - The selected system is returning an authentication error. Please verify the destination configuration

It works for cross-global accounts. The S/4 HANA Public Cloud system must trust your specific BAS subaccount, requiring uploading its signing certificate. If you switch subaccounts, upload the new certificate.

Let me know if it works

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: How Future-Minded HR is Shaping Mindsets to Enable Change
entry.content:
The Future is Now: Accelerating HR Evolution

HR's future is here, not tomorrow. To meet the new and ever-changing business needs, HR teams must accelerate their evolution. Traditional HR practices are being replaced with agile, future-focused strategies and tech enabled strategies that not only address today's challenges but anticipate tomorrow's requirements. One innovative approach gaining traction is "back-casting." This strategy involves envisioning the future business landscape and then planning backward to align HR initiatives with those future needs, and also increase HR people skills around technology

Back-casting: Planning for the Future

Back-casting is being adopted by top organizations across various functions. It involves:

  1. Understanding the Future Business Environment: HR professionals must look ahead to understand the projected competitive environment, customer priorities and needs, and the global business landscape.
  2. Skills Forecasting: Identifying the skills that will be crucial for future business success.
  3. Innovative Solutions: Developing HR strategies that are flexible and adaptive, technology enabled and capable of evolving with the business's future needs.

An Outside-In Approach

To truly dive into the future, HR must adopt an outside-in perspective. This involves:

  • Competitive Analysis: Understanding the competitive environment and how it may change.
  • Customer Insights: Recognizing and anticipating customer priorities and needs.
  • Global Trends: Keeping abreast of global environmental factors that might impact the business.
  • Skills Projections: Forecasting the skills required for the organization to remain successful and competitive.

By taking these steps, HR can start acting now to resolve tomorrow's needs rather than focusing solely on current challenges, which may already be outdated.

Shaping Organizational Mindsets

Organizational mindset refers to the collective beliefs, attitudes, and assumptions held by members of an organization. These mindsets shape the organization's culture, govern its behaviors, and influence its decision-making processes. To enable change, future-minded HR is fostering a cloud mindset.

The Cloud Mindset: Embracing Intelligent Technology

A cloud mindset goes beyond mere cloud infrastructure implementation. It optimizes the use of intelligent technology to create a forward-thinking organizational culture. Key components of a cloud mindset include:

  1. Data-Driven Decision Making: Leveraging the availability and use of data to make informed decisions.
  2. Self-Service at All Levels: Empowering HR teams, people managers, and employees with self-service tools.
  3. Adoption of Standard Processes: Utilizing standardized processes on technology platforms to enhance efficiency.
  4. Continuous Change: Embracing a culture of continuous improvement and adaptation.

Conclusion

Future-minded HR is not just about preparing for what lies ahead; it is about actively shaping the future through proactive strategies and forward-thinking mindsets. By adopting back-casting, utilizing an outside-in approach, and fostering a cloud mindset, HR can ensure that organizations are well-prepared to thrive in the evolving competitive landscape. The time to act is now—the future of HR is already here.

Embrace the future, act today, and shape mindsets to enable lasting change.

To retrieve a Delivery, Note PDF from your BTP CAP app:

Generate and persist the PDF in S/4HANA Cloud.

Configure output management for outbound delivery to generate FDP_V2_DELIVERY_NOTE_V1 and store the PDF on the delivery by determining the output parameters.

Retrieve via Attachments API. Call API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV in your CAP service to list originals, then use GetStream to return the PDF to your UI.

entry.title: Re: Error with BAdI Implementation PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITIO...
entry.content:
Good day @Adrianqui192 

Thank you for your question.

Based on your screenshots, the error regarding enhancement identifier happens in public cloud when you don’t properly link your defined BAdI or if it is not recognised in SSSCUI. There are steps to manage it:

1.  First is to ensure your BAdI implementation has FORMULAR equals TPEI, then ensure the status is set to published and your extension point ID is PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT. This can be achieved in your custom logic app. Ensure you create

2.  Secondly, in you SSCUI, ensure you create a new routine with the Enhancement Identifier TPEI. You can achieve this by following the 3 steps required creation.

3.  Thereafter, assign the routine in your pricing procedure under the condition type and re-publish the BAdI.

Once concluded, the pricing engine will call your custom routine when condition type is processed.

Have a look at these links for more details.

Custom Logic: Condition Amount

How to configure a Routine for SSCUI 102430 and 102808

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/not-able-to-update-sales-pricing-data-dynamically-for-different-pricing/qaq-p/14008934

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Visiting Our ICX Integration Support Team in Galway : A Week of Learning, Training & Connection
entry.content:
In September 2025,

I had the pleasure of spending time with our amazing support team in Galway, Ireland, for one business week— and what a week it was! From face-to-face training sessions to valuable cross-team conversations, the agenda was packed with learning, sharing, and building stronger connections.

 

Day 1: Arrival & First Impressions

I got to SAP Ireland in Galway on Monday, September 29th, 2025, excited to finally meet the team in person for the first time, after five years of teamwork. While we collaborate regularly online, nothing quite compares to the energy of being in the same room.

We kicked things off with casual introductions and a tour of the office, as well as in the Parkmore area, followed by a team lunch that set a great tone for the week.

📅  The Agenda: A Week of Activities

Here’s a quick look at how the week shaped up:

  • Monday: Welcome, team introductions, office tour, informal catch-ups

  • Tuesday:

    KT session delivered by PAL on the following topics, followed by Q&A:

  • Organization Status, reports, and mid-term goals.
  • Integration Data Flows
  • Sales Cloud Version 2
  • Service Cloud Version 2
  • System Landscape
  • Technical System Settings
  • Object Dependencies
  • Monitoring
  • Road Map & WN

  KT delivered about: Data Connector - Troubleshooting

  • Wednesday: Shadowing support calls and learning sessions

  KT delivered by PM Development about: Event Mesh Outbound Messages in V2

  • Thursday: Cross-team meetings with C4C/CNS Integration Team; 1:1s with Integration Product Area Lead and Support Engineers as well as PAL and SRL (a.k.a Support Readiness Lead).

   KT delivered by David Smyth about:  BADIs in C4C NGAP.

  • Friday: Retrospective discussion, takeaways, and wrap-up lunch

On the last day in office, we had to change the original schedule a bit due to severe climate conditions; to avoid any incident, everybody was asked to leave the office to stay home due to an orange alert for the storm "Amy", so our wrap-up meeting had to be skipped. Luckily, everybody got safe at home safely and could finish the working. This “weather” occurrence was the only thing missing to have a definite, full experience of Galwayer life 🙂

💬  Training & Knowledge Sharing

One of the key goals of my visit was to deliver a training session on CNS Integration topics (the development and myself), but ideally also meet the colleagues in person to streamline the connection and collect feedback. It was great to see the team so engaged, asking questions and offering real-time feedback based on their day-to-day experience.

I also learned a lot by sitting in on their support analysis and seeing how they handle customer interactions, complex cases, and high demand in the backlog.

🤝Cross-Team Collaboration

Throughout the week, I also had the opportunity to meet with members of other teams based in Galway — including other C4C Expert Area experts, other LOBs, like ByD, S4HC, SFSF and MCC. These chats opened the door to some exciting ideas for improving our workflows and collaboration moving forward.

📝Key Takeaways

By the end of the week, I came away with:

  • A deeper appreciation for the C4C Integration team’s work and dedication

  • Valuable feedback on our current processes and main challenges

  • New ideas for future training and team support

  • Stronger relationships that will make remote collaboration even smoother

🎉Wrapping Up

A huge thank you to everyone, in particular to I&CX - Sales & Service Cloud Integration Team in Ireland, our Support Readiness Leader, and our Leadership Team, for the opportunity, for the warm welcome, thoughtful conversations, and enthusiastic participation.

It was an energizing week, and I’m looking forward to putting what we learned into action!

Funny habits between Ireland and Brazil we could identify:

quirky Brazilian habits

  • Spend much more time outdoors
  • Always decide whether to Debit or Credit
  • Wear a white outfit on New Year's Eve
  • For many people, the new year actually starts after Carnaval
  • Cheek kisses when meeting or leaving
  • Clapping along during H-Bday song
  • Eating dinner late
  • Kids call adults "aunt" and "uncle" even if they´re not family.

quirky Irish habits

  • We must go for a pint
  • Wear Summer Clothes on Winter or cold days
  • Nickname for ppl from Galway: The Tribesmen
  • The city got famous with the "Galway girl" song by Ed Sheeran
  • Fenian Claddagh ring: if you turn it forward that means you're single if it's facing towards you that means you're married

Integration Team:

David Boyle; David Smyth;Pedro;Tales and Antonio

Tales Caron and Mehdi Senhaji

 

Tales and Jean-MarieTeam Dinner

 

Guinness experience

 

Until next time !

entry.title: 5 Key Takeaways from SAP Connect: Innovations, Strategy, and What’s Ahead for the Future of Hiring
entry.content:
This year’s inaugural SAP Connect brought together customers, partners, and experts from around the world to explore how innovation, AI, and connected data are shaping the next era of workforce and business transformation.

Across keynotes, strategy sessions, product demos, roundtable discussions and customers sessions, one message is clear: organizations are ready to accelerate toward a future where AI, people intelligence, and end-to-end talent experiences power hiring and business success.

Whether you were able to join us in person, or tuned-in virtually, here are my top 5 takeaways from the event.

Key Highlights:  

1. Intelligent Hiring Takes Center Stage

The spotlight was on the exciting combination of SAP SuccessFactors and SmartRecruiters, showcasing how, together, we’re redefining what’s possible in talent acquisition. 

During the Success Connect keynote, Unprecedented possibilities: Connecting people and your business, Dan Beck, General Manager and Chief Product Officer of SAP SuccessFactors welcomed Rebecca Carr, CEO of SmartRecruiters, to the stage to share the value that SmartRecruiters brings to the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite. Dan shared the big news, stating, “We acquired SmartRecruiters – the best company in the talent acquisition space.” And acknowledging the excitement and buzz heard around the show floor, he emphasized to customers, “I want to be really clear with you, for our current SuccessFactors customers: as and when you see fit, we will help you migrate to the SmartRecruiters solution on your timeline. And I think you’ll love what you’re going to see about this product.”

As Rebecca took the stage, she shared how deeply personal hiring challenges are for individuals and organizations alike – with tedious and frustrating steps for both candidates and hiring teams. She intends to alleviate that for organizations, introducing SmartRecruiters as a platform designed to make hiring simple. “We can deliver better quality of hire, faster time to fill, and a candidate experience that makes people want to work for you. That means clearer communication, faster decisioning, and a process that ultimately reflects your brand.”

As the keynote continued, Rebecca shared a product demo and highlighted exciting innovations to come. The quick preview of upcoming capabilities showcases the customer-centricity that SmartRecruiters continues to bring to their offering – delivering innovations that support better candidate discovery, more efficient work, proactive insights, and personalized experiences across the hiring journey.

Watch the Keynote on SAP Connect Virtual now!

2. See SmartRecruiters in Action

Attendees had multiple opportunities to see SmartRecruiters and SAP SuccessFactors live – with demo sessions, product deep dives, 1:1 meetings, and more. But – if you weren’t with us in Las Vegas, you still have the opportunity to watch the product demo, New possibilities with SmartRecruiters: Aligning roles, skills and AI for success, as part of SAP Connect Virtual.

Amy Oxley, Global Center of Excellence Lead at SmartRecruiters, walks you through a demo of SmartRecruiters. She introduces the solution, “At SmartRecruiters, the foundation of our platform is SmartOS, from everything from job posting to engaging your talent within the CRM, right the way through to offers and pre-boarding. And the AI layer to that is Winston, our AI hiring hero: Your agent to support your candidates, your recruiters, and your hiring managers at every stage of the journey – from screening and matching to completing actions and providing support through interview feedback.”

Watch the full Solution Deep Dive on SAP Connect Virtual now & explore a portal full of demo content curated for SAP Connect.

3. Discover How SAP SuccessFactors and SmartRecruiters Come Together  

The Experience Center provided attendees with an interactive walkthrough to experience the full impact of SAP solutions across all lines of business and industries. This persona-driven experience also included SAP SuccessFactors, SmartRecruiters, and SAP Business AI together, demonstrating how organizations can enhance recruiting and onboarding – from faster candidate matching to personalized, guided journeys for new hires.

While the onsite experience was only available in Las Vegas, you can explore the Virtual Showcase at any time. Walk through the entire end-to-end HCM suite experience, chat with Winston, and discover the next era of intelligent hiring.

Explore the Virtual Showcase and how to Optimize Talent Acquisition now!   

4. Your Most Pressing Questions, Answered

The enthusiasm and chatter around SmartRecruiters was heard in every corner of the entire event. Whether in Ask the Experts sessions, Roundtable Discussions, 1:1 Meetings, Booth Demos, or just over light bites in the moments in between – everyone was talking about it. And, there were a lot of questions! We heard you – and so, we thought it’d be best to speak directly to Dan Beck and Rebecca Carr and address your top of mind questions in a live interview.

Watch the full interview with Dan and Rebecca now! 

Additionally, we caught up with Lara Albert, Chief Marketing Officer of SAP SuccessFactors, to get her perspective during the Welcome to SAP Connect Virtual Keynote recap. Lara shared, “We are so excited about this. The whole entire team is just incredibly optimistic about what this means for our business, and more importantly what it means for our customers. When you look at SmartRecruiters, you’ve got a best of breed talent acquisition solution with key capabilities that are going to complement our SuccessFactors HCM suite.”

Lara continues, “Ultimately, we’re talking about being able to not only help organizations attract the best talent no matter where it exists, but then nurture that talent across the entire employee lifecycle.”

Watch Lara in the Welcome to SAP Connect Virtual now!

5. Connect Everything, Achieve Anything

That was the theme of this year’s incredible SAP Connect. While that theme permeated across the every keynote, session, and experience that was showcased at the event, it strongly resonates when it comes to the future of intelligent hiring. As part of SAP Business Suite, our AI-driven talent acquisition, talent management, and human capital management solutions ensure every hire is aligned to business and workforce goals. Together, SAP SuccessFactors and SmartRecruiters enable organizations to simplify global hiring with an intelligent, end-to-end solution that supports any hiring and HR need.

Learn more about how SAP SuccessFactors and SmartRecruiters are helping organizations attract, hire, and onboard top talent.  

Looking Ahead

SAP Connect highlighted how innovation, collaboration, and customer partnership continue to fuel the next era of HCM technology. A huge thank you to all of our customers, partners, and industry experts who joined us in person and online! Your energy, insights, and passion are what makes our community thrive.

We can’t wait to continue this conversation – and continue building the future of intelligent hiring together – with you.

Check back soon for all session content!

entry.title: Re: Is it Mandatory to have Cloud foundry runtime with Bu...
entry.content: Hi Yogesh, Just for BAS we don't need CF runtime. In a customer environment we enabled BAS in a separate developer only subaccount, in this subaccount CF was not enabled as the apps were to be deployed in another subaccount. If in the same subaccount as BAS you want to create instances of other services you will need CF for sure.

entry.title: Re: Changing Source System from ECC to S/4HANA in CI_DS
entry.content:
Hello Sunkardutt

Once the tasks created, the source/ target datastores cannot be changed.
But you can create a new configuration for the migrated S/4HANA system in the source datastore of the existing task.

Best Regards,
Joy
